scenes.heading: EXT. DUKES ROASTERY DOCK — L ATE MORNING.

dialogues.text: Oh, now we gotta stop here so you can get with some like, random girl, but whatever.
She’s not some random girl! We’ve been, like, flirting with each other since fucking grade eight. I gotta at least shoot my shot before I leave.
If this works, you’ve officially gotten every girl in town. Every single girl.
No. You’re good, you’re good, you’re good...
I’m gonna be honest and tell her I’m leaving in three weeks. If that leads to us banging...
That musta been God’s plan. That’s out of my hands. You know what I mean?
You gotta slow down. You gotta slow down.
I’m sorry, I’m like, I’m so used to driving boats that drive like this... (she mimics a steering wheel)
Maybe you should actually get your boating license.
I’ve been driving heavy machinery since I was eight, Ruthie. So...
Help me pull it in. Pull it in. (as they do) I don’t think boating licenses are, like, a real thing. It’s like a formality.
Okay. Grab that rope at the end...
Fucking life or death experience right there.
You be s afe, kid. Wrap it up!
Oh, bitch. My back is thrown.
I know. Like, my neck... CUT TO:

dialogues.text: They’re like, they’re a medical marvel, right ?

dialogues.text: It’s going to ruin the surprise!

dialogues.text: No, so listen. I had an uncle because my aunt married this guy... but then they got divorced, but he had a guinea pig. The PetSmart that he bought it from, he had...

No! Nothing bad is gonna happen.
What if one of us like, gets too high and says something fucked up and it changes the fabric of our friendship forever?

Chug it, chug it, chug it!

scenes.heading: EXT. CAMPSITE BONFIRE. NIGHT.

dialogues.text: Actually, I’m a little scared too.
I feel like I need to call my mom.
There are bears here. My mom told me.
Shut up. Let’s just be normal guys and talk about something, something normal. Something...
Let’s just talk about something normal.
Word, word. I’ve got hopes and dreams. Okay. Well... (thinks, then) I’m just excited that my life is about to finally start.
Even though the world is literally on fire and full of uneducated racists, I’m trying to force m yself to have... hope? CONTINUED: (MORE) 11
Uh. Like, mad respect to my ancestors but I do NOT wanna be a third generation... (thinks, corrects) I
And I always feel bad every time I say that but it’s like - I’ve got energy, I’ve got hype!
Like the world? The world is literally our fucking oyster, like we gotta LIVE, you know what I mean?
Holy shi -- oh my god. Are you trippin? Are you guys trippin?
I feel like grooving, man. I feel like grooving. CONTINUED:
Oh my god. (to herself, flabbergasted) “I feel like grooving man.” Wow.
You know it’s cause you don’t tolerate drugs well.
Oh. Yes, yes, yes. Oh, yes. (re: the marshmallows)
Do you work for my da d? Did he send you here to spy on me?
(sighs heavily) I don’t know how to say this... (whispers)
What are you talking about? (a beat)
Your teeth. Those aren’t my teeth.
There’s a fucking gap in your teeth. I don’t have a gap in my teeth.
Yeah, dude, fuck you. Wear your retainer.
And your hair, it’s so dry... and it’s dark.
You have bangs. I don’t have bangs - I have no plans on getting bangs.
And your boobs are saggy. My boobs aren’t saggy.
Forgot how fucking dense I was. Let me show you something. Um, this... (points to a scar)
Left boob, one cup smaller than the right. And no, it never catches up to the right but honestly, you get used to it and it’s okay. Guy’s can’ t really tell. Girls can, but...
Ta-da! It’s our missing pinky toe.
Oh, fuck. That hasn’t happened yet.
Nice! Okay. I’m feeling it. I’m having a reaction to the shrooms.
I’m actually kinda hot for being middle aged.
Okay. Fuck you. I’m thirty-nine years old that’s not middle aged.
No, it’s NOT. I’m a very young adult.
NOBODY says “gagging over it” anymore either. So...
Wait. Oh my god. Okay. Tell me everything! Where do we live? Do we have kids? Are we like, SO happy and fulfilled?
This is turning into a bad trip. I feel this is turning into a bad trip. And I’m trying to have a good time, but you’re giving me a fucking panic atta ck.
Why are you struggling to find something good from the future?
You are going to be fucking psyched to know that you are a...
But I don’t want to tell you in what because I want you to have something to look forward to.
Look FORWARD to? Did you just tell me I’m in my forties and still in SCHOOL!?
Dude. What the fuck? Did you honestly think you were gonna be married, have multiple kids AND your dream job by the time you were forty?
Wait. I just had the best idea. You tell me who the next Apple is and I’ll invest now and then we can be INSANELY rich.
I don’t think that’s a good idea.
Because I don’t know how this shit works. I
Oh, come on. What’s the point of this conversation if you can’t at least give me some advice to make our life better? CONTINUED: 19
Alright. That’s not, like, the “fix.” I don’t think that’s the...
You’re telling me that wouldn’t fix at least a couple of your problems?
I just, I don’t think I...
Or is our life just so flawless and perfect that you don’t wanna change anything?
Can you avoid anyone named Chad?
What? Who the fuck is Chad? (not impressed)
This is the weirdest fucking thing...
I’m not gonna FaceTime Mom when I’m high.
Dude. I know she can be annoying but, like... be nice to her.
I’m SO nice to Mom. (off Older Elliott) I literally let her talk to me yesterday about a hummingbird for forty five minutes.
Honestly, you should hang out with her. Like, hang out with her. Do stuff with her.
Oh, my god. That’s who you look like! Mom! That’s who you look like. You look exactly like Mom. What the fuck?
Yes. All the time. Everybody says that. Everybody.
Holy shit. That’s crazy. Everyone just turns into their mothers. CONTINUED: 21
Yeah, basically. Honestly, I thought it was a bad thing, but I kind of like it now.
I thought I’d be happier at forty. CUT TO:

scenes.actionPreview: It’s very quiet now. Some time has clearly passed. The three of them sit and stare silently into the crackling bonfire. The water laps. A loon cries out. A twig snaps off camera, they turn and look. Def scared. No one knows what to say. Um. Can you like talk about your hopes and dreams or something,

scenes.heading: INT. TENT. LATER.

dialogues.text: You don’t look happy. I feel like... you’re having a midlife crisis.
Well, I feel like you're high on mushrooms so you don't know shit.
True. (a beat, smiles) I have an idea. Can we... kiss?
It's just a kiss. It's not, like... sexual.
Why do you want to kiss yourself?
You don't want to know what it's like to kiss yourself?
I mean, yes, I do, but it's like you're younger so it's weird.
Okay, can I at least touch my old ass?
Oh, my god. You need to be locked up.
Just a quickie. I'm not gonna, like...
I'm not gonna, like, shove tongue in your mouth.
Fine, kiss me, I don't care.
I just wanted to know what it was like to kiss myself.
That was fucking hot and you know it.
Okay. Can I say one last thing?
You are so lucky. Life will never be the same as it is right now.
You're gonna go to the city and everything's gonna be exciting and busy and... You don't even go home for Thanksgiving this year. You stay in the city.
The only thing you can't get back is time. When you get older, it goes by so fast, dude. So fast.

scenes.actionPreview: They are now crammed inside the tent. A beat as they stare up at the ceiling. This cuts through Older Elliott like a KNIFE. The camera is above both of them, oddly familiar yet so different. They both sigh and move their hair out of their face in an eerily similar way. are happy. And I’m not forty,

-- to comprehend the fact that I’m on the phone with MY OLD ASS!

For the money and the fame.
(like, how dare you disrespec t him)

Yeah, I never um, met my grandfather or even seen the farm before it got sold or anything. He died before I was born. Yeah. It’s been really nice... I think I just wanted to, get in touch with my roots. If that isn’t the cheesiest thing you’ve ever heard.

dialogues.text: I’d heard some rumors. Something about zoning changes and it affecting the reservoir ponds or something but didn’t know it was a for sure thing.
FUCK. So even the summer boy workers knew about it before me.

I was fine leaving. I was really excited to leave. I just always thought it was gonna be here to come back to. So it feels REALLY diffe rent now. ‘Cause when I leave, I’m saying goodbye forever. And I HATE goodbyes. (she sighs) I just really wish time would stop for a second so I could enjoy it a little bit longer.
Sorry. I shouldn't be venting all this at you. Throwing it at you.
What ? Dude, no, I get it. I actually get it.
Do you remember the last time you were a little kid and went to a friend’s house and just like, played pretend all day?
I mean, I remember doing that a lot.
Yeah, but can you remember the very LAST time you ever did it?

It’s that sad? To think that there was a time we were just like, out riding bikes with our friends like imagining we were being chased by zombies. Covered in dirt and sweat, having the BEST TIME. And then we went home that night and put our bike in the g arage and went to bed not realizing that was the last time we were ever gonna do that.
But the thing about not saying goodbyes is that you also miss savoring when it might be last time you’ll ever get do that thing.
I don’t know I... sort of... it doesn’t make sense.

Just back to my house is fine.
I just, I just have to go.
Do you have your boating license?

dialogues.text: Good. T hey sit in silence, looking out over the water.

It’s like, transcendental meditation but better. Penelope
Oh, fuck, I was so worried about you. I had to eat like three pounds of my girlfriend’s friend’s weed to get here. Are you ok?
What is that? Why? WHY. It’s not even dragonfly season yet.
I told you Elliott, we don’t tolerate drugs well! I don’t know what to tell you. I’m really high. I need like water or something. CONTINUED: 94

I found out about the farm and then, all the Chad stuff happened --
Well. That’s what I’ve been trying to... talk to you... about.
I ’ve been trying, okay? Really hard. And I get it now. All the other advice was so good. Like I was taking so much of our life and our family for granted. Yeah, I see that now, okay?
But I was just too scared to tell you when I started falling in love with Chad. (off My Old Ass) I know. I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I didn’t wanna let you down or mess up our life or something. But --

I swear to god, tell me. It literally cannot be that bad --

dialogues.text: You’r e right, Elliott. I should listen to you. I never realized how wise my young ass was. (beat)

scenes.actionPreview: Elliott’s family is sitting around having game night except it’s the exact opposite of the picture perfect family scene. They’re playing Settlers of Catan and things have gotten UGLY and everyone is fighting. Spencer grabs Chad’s hand and pulls him into the living room. Okay, that sounded weird. Off

scenes.heading: INT. ELLIOTT’S BATHROOM. LATE NIGHT.

dialogues.text: But, what I’m trying to say is, you’re right. You shouldn’t live your life for me, or for the future or get
I’m so happy you fell in love with
Loving Chad is a gift. And being loved by him is the best fucking thing in the world. CONTINUED: 102
So, just, fuck it. Keep being the naive, dumb, pore-less, smart, happy, confident, brave, self centered, optimistic idiot that you are because it’s... perfect. And go live your life with Chad. (then)

scenes.actionPreview: Elliott pees in the dark. Plays the message. Elliott laughs, wipes away a tear. stuck in the past. Because that is not living. Elliott fights a throat lump. Chad. Because... We hear the emotion in her voice. Elliott wipes a tear. Or Chad and your three wives or whatever you decide is right for you.

scenes.heading: EXT. LAKE MUSKOKA. LATE MORNING.
scenes.actionPreview: Elliott drives the boat. Her hair whips wildly all over the place. A massive smile on her face. Off Elliott, as she yells and guns the engine to its limit.
